title: `src/test/ui/process/nofile-limit.rs` failing with linker error on WSL
body:
It's failing during the normal UI test procedure, but I'm running it in isolation here to simplify debugging.

Running `rustc src/test/ui/process/nofile-limit.rs -Ctarget-feature=+crt-static -Crpath=no -Crelocation-model=static` returns a linker error on my WSL system.

```
error: linking with `cc` failed: exit status: 1
  |
  = note: "cc" "-m64" "/tmp/rustcc1HvnX/symbols.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.0.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.1.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.10.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.11.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.12.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.13.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.14.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.15.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.2.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.3.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.4.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.nofile_limit.e85bd7aa-cgu.5.rcgu.o" "nofile-limit.1sahotabcnr340dm.rcgu.o" "-Wl,--as-needed" "-L" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib" "-Wl,--start-group" "-Wl,-Bstatic" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libstd-1ea5740dc82c7a34.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libpanic_unwind-9cdaf64f7570f7ff.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libobject-7d64cc870c011631.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libaddr2line-315eac6a3174b13c.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libgimli-778610d63efc39ce.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_demangle-11737b9eef3e285d.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libstd_detect-8165420a20fe4548.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_std_workspace_alloc-5f171797b6654b84.rlib" "-lgcc" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/liballoc-dfc71beee59013ce.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_std_workspace_core-522518611024dce5.rlib" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcore-05898138a596088a.rlib" "-Wl,--end-group" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcompiler_builtins-6f7f4877ee9c613e.rlib" "-Wl,-Bdynamic" "-Wl,--eh-frame-hdr" "-Wl,-znoexecstack" "-L" "/home/nilsh/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib" "-o" "nofile-limit" "-Wl,--gc-sections" "-static" "-no-pie" "-Wl,-zrelro,-znow" "-nodefaultlibs"
  = note: /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/9/../../../x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.a(pthread_join_common.o)(.note.stapsdt+0x14): error: relocation refers to local symbol "" [2], which is defined in a discarded section
          /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/9/../../../x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.a(pthread_join_common.o)(.note.stapsdt+0x60): error: relocation refers to local symbol "" [2], which is defined in a discarded section
          collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status


error: aborting due to previous error
```

Curiously, running it with mold (`mold -run rustc +dev src/test/ui/process/nofile-limit.rs -Ctarget-feature=+crt-static -Crpath=no -Crelocation-model=static`) works fine.

Running it with `CC=clang` does not help.

Running it without `-Crelocation-model=static`, which was added recently in #TODO yields a warning and a linker error 
```
 WARN rustc_codegen_ssa::back::link Linker does not support -static-pie command line option. Retrying with -static instead.
error: linking with `cc` failed: exit status: 1
```

`ld -v`: `GNU gold (GNU Binutils for Ubuntu 2.34) 1.16`
`mold -v`: `mold 1.3.0 (a9a8205be29f36346bfdbfadee8ed147e06aa1f6; compatible with GNU ld)`
OS: `OS: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS on Windows 10 x86_64`
`ldd --version`: `ldd (Ubuntu GLIBC 2.31-0ubuntu9.9) 2.31`
